files.summary: Popup page for selecting an answer type and answer scale when building a CME evaluation template question. Displays both standard and sliding-scale answer types and supports free-form answer configurations.
files.businessPurpose: Allows administrators to pick the answer scale and answer type for each CME evaluation question during the evaluation design wizard.
keyMethods: Page_Load - initializes page and populates answer scale list on first load
InitializePage - sets page mode and calls fill/refresh helpers
SetCurrentPageMode - determines Add vs Edit mode from session template info
GetAnswerTypes - filters a DataTable into sliding vs non-sliding answer type rows
refreshList - binds answer type and sliding scale DataList controls by selected scale
drawFreeFormItems - binds free-form answer types with special line-text ordering
fillAnswerScales - loads answer scale dropdown and restores selection from query string
GetEWEEHeading - builds display string annotating EarlyWarning/ExceedExpectation badges
GetAnswerTypeHeading - returns formatted answer type name with EarlyWarning annotation
dlstAnswerTypes_ItemDataBound - configures free-form TextBox dimensions per answer code
lstScale_SelectedIndexChanged - reloads answer type list when scale selection changes
lstAnswerType_SelectedIndexChanged - stores selected answer type and returns result to parent
files.migrationNote: Core to CME evaluation template designer; answer-type selection logic must be replicated in the modern stack.

files.summary: Read-only information page that displays details of a CME event schedule (event name, topic, location, dates, credits, speakers, assigned users, and learning objectives) for assignment reference.
files.businessPurpose: Gives coordinators a summary view of a CME event schedule before or after assigning evaluations.
keyMethods: Page_Load - triggers FillInfoFromDB on initial load
FillInfoFromDB - fetches CME event schedule data by SID and populates all display labels
files.migrationNote: Read-only info display; straightforward to migrate as a detail endpoint.

files.summary: Navigation menu page for the CME assignment area that enforces role-based access control for GA-Emergency and related roles, and conditionally shows or hides help icons based on available help content.
files.businessPurpose: Presents the CME assignment sub-menu to authorized users, restricting access for special roles (GA-Emergency, GA-Conf/MyQ/MyP) as configured.
keyMethods: Page_Load - runs permission check and help icon configuration on every request
CheckForPermissions - blocks special GA roles that lack CMEAssignMenu privileges
SetHelpIcons - shows or hides admin vs regular help icon links per help content availability
files.migrationNote: Navigation scaffold; logic is mainly permission checks that map to modern RBAC middleware.

files.summary: Add/Edit form for a CME online course, managing speakers, credit types, linked events, evaluations, quizzes, handouts, videos, and learning objectives with full CRUD support.
files.businessPurpose: Enables CME administrators to create or update online CME courses that learners can take to earn credit.
keyMethods: Page_Load - sets page mode, checks permissions, and initializes the form
CheckForPermissions - enforces CMETracking Courses module privileges
InitializePage - binds all dropdown/list controls and loads edit-mode data on first request
BindPassPercentage - populates passing baseline percentage dropdown
BindAvailableSpeakers - loads available lecturer list from ScheduleTemplateManager
BindEvents - loads event list from EventManager
BindEvaluations - loads published CME template list from TemplateManager
BindQuiz - loads quiz list for the course
BindCreditTypes - loads credit type options
BindEventCredits - populates event credit dropdown
btnAddLecturer_Click - moves selected speakers to the chosen list
btnRemoveLecturer_Click - moves selected speakers back to available list
UpdateSpcakerList - handles add/remove speaker list management including guest lecturers
StorePageStateToParm - persists CourseID from query string to view state
PrepareFormForEditMode - fills form controls from DB for edit mode
FillInfoFromDB - maps CourseInfo object fields to form controls
btnSave_Click - validates and saves or updates the course record
files.migrationNote: Online CME course management is a core data entry workflow with complex many-to-many speaker/handout/video relationships.

files.summary: Learner-facing dashboard listing pending and online CME evaluation assignments for the logged-in user, with sortable and paginated grids and a tab distinguishing normal vs online CME activities.
files.businessPurpose: Shows healthcare professionals their outstanding CME evaluation assignments so they can access and complete them.
keyMethods: Page_Load - initializes grid page sizes, loads session messages, and calls grid refresh methods
refreshGrid - binds the pending CME evaluations grid using GetIncompleteCMEEvaluationsForMultiTopics
refreshOnlineActivityGrid - binds the online CME activity grid for online-type evaluations
CheckForPermissions - checks CompleteCMEEvaluations submodule view privileges
GetActionText - determines if the action link is visible based on user identity
GetCMEEventType - retrieves the CME event type flag for tab display logic
FillPageListCombo - populates top and bottom page navigation dropdowns
SortGridView - applies column sort to the grid data source
files.migrationNote: Learner-facing CME todo list; a critical user-facing feature to replicate in the modern frontend.

files.summary: Popup page that renders a grid of audit trail details for a specific CME evaluation, showing completed, partially completed, or declined status history based on the EntityID parameter.
files.businessPurpose: Provides administrators with an audit log of status changes for a CME evaluation for compliance and tracking purposes.
keyMethods: Page_Load - decrypts query string IDs, fetches audit trail data, and binds the grid with dynamic header text
files.migrationNote: Audit trail display for CME evaluations; important for compliance reporting.

files.summary: Read-only information page that displays metadata about a CME evaluation template (name, published by, and published date) given a template ID query parameter.
files.businessPurpose: Provides a quick-view popup of CME evaluation template details for reference during assignment workflows.
keyMethods: Page_Load - triggers BindCMEEvaluationInfo on first load
BindCMEEvaluationInfo - fetches TemplateInfo by ID and populates name, publisher, and date labels
files.migrationNote: Simple read-only detail view; can be replaced by an API detail endpoint.

files.summary: Minimal scheduler trigger page that calls CMEBussiness.OnViewInitializeCMEEvaluationReminderEmailScheduler to send reminder emails for pending CME evaluations.
files.businessPurpose: Acts as a web-based cron trigger for the CME evaluation reminder email job, typically invoked by a Windows scheduled task or HTTP ping.
keyMethods: Page_Load - invokes CMEBussiness reminder email scheduler method
files.migrationNote: Scheduler trigger pattern; migrate to a BullMQ worker job in the Node.js backend.

files.summary: Read-only information popup for a CME event showing event name, credits, credit types, and target audience fetched by event ID.
files.businessPurpose: Provides a quick reference view of CME event details during scheduling or assignment workflows.
keyMethods: Page_Load - calls FillinfoViewMode on first load
FillinfoViewMode - parses EventID query param and fetches event info
FillInfoByDBViewMode - maps EventInfo fields to display labels
files.migrationNote: Simple read-only detail popup; straightforward API endpoint in modern stack.

files.summary: Registration form for CME training events that handles payment processing via Authorize.Net, Square, and Clover merchant services, supports add/edit/view modes, and sends confirmation emails.
files.businessPurpose: Allows users to register for paid or free CME training seminars, process credit card payments, and receive confirmation email notifications.
keyMethods: Page_Load - initializes page mode and calls business layer and page setup
InitializePage - loads event details, payment amounts, merchant service credentials, and department info
StorePageParamsToState - persists TrainingID from query string
PrepareFormForEditMode - loads existing registration data for editing
PrepareFormForViewMode - loads read-only registration data
CheckForPermissions - validates TrainingEvent module view privilege
FillInfoFromDB - populates form controls from a training seminar record
FillInfo - fills read-only view form controls
btnSubmitRegistration_Click - submits new registration with payment processing
btnUpdateRegistration_Click - updates existing registration record
ProcessAuthorizeNetPayment - submits charge via Authorize.Net API
ProcessSquarePayment - submits charge via Square API
ProcessCloverPayment - submits charge via Clover API
files.migrationNote: Complex payment processing with three gateway integrations (Authorize.Net, Square, Clover); high priority for migration planning due to PCI compliance implications.

files.summary: Main navigation hub for the CME Tracking module, dynamically building the left-side menu by checking role privileges for each CME sub-section (evaluations, events, courses, conferences, reports, assignments) and toggling PARS/MyCME+ mode based on department settings.
files.businessPurpose: Presents a role-filtered CME module menu to users, conditionally exposing CME evaluation design, assignment management, conference tracking, reporting, and PARS connectivity links.
keyMethods: Page_Load - runs permission check, initializes page, sets help icons, stores chatbot params, and logs page access
CheckForPermissions - enforces user type and special GA role access rules
InitializePage - conditionally removes menu items based on privileges and toggles PARS vs standard CME menu mode
SetHelpIcons - configures context-sensitive help icon visibility for each menu section
files.migrationNote: Navigation shell; menu structure logic maps to frontend routing with permission guards in the modern app.

files.summary: Add/Edit form for CME evaluation questions, supporting question code auto-generation, category selection, CKEditor rich-text question body, and a comment-required toggle.
files.businessPurpose: Allows CME administrators to create or update individual evaluation questions that are used when building CME evaluation templates.
keyMethods: Page_Load - sets page mode, stores params to state, checks permissions, and initializes the form
StorePageParamsToState - persists QuestionId from query string in edit mode
CheckPermissions - enforces CmeQuestions module privilege and sets Save button visibility
InitilizePage - sets page title, populates category dropdown, and pre-populates question code
fillQuestionCategory - loads CME question categories from QuestionManager
FillInfoFromForm - builds QuestionInfo from form fields including sliding scale detection
PrepareFormForEditMode - loads existing question data for editing
FillInfoFromDB - populates form controls including CKEditor script injection
btnSave_Click - validates and saves or updates the question record
GetQuestionCode - auto-generates next sequential question code based on category
GetServerExecutionURL - returns handler URL for async question operations
Getparams - builds user/department parameter string for AJAX calls
files.migrationNote: Question management is foundational to CME evaluation template design.

files.summary: Simple dialog for copying (duplicating) an existing CME evaluation template under a new name, validating the new title before saving.
files.businessPurpose: Enables administrators to quickly create a new CME evaluation template based on an existing one without rebuilding it from scratch.
keyMethods: Page_Load - calls InitializePage
InitializePage - loads the source template name on first request
btnCopy_Click - validates new title and saves the copied template
GetTemplateToCopy - fetches the source TemplateInfo by ID and stores in page state
btnCancel_Click - redirects back to ManageCmeEvaluations
files.migrationNote: Copy/duplicate pattern for evaluation templates; straightforward API action in the modern stack.

files.summary: Add/Edit page for configuring a department's CME credit certificate template, including heading, sub-heading, logo image upload, credit category, and custom descriptor text blocks.
files.businessPurpose: Allows CME administrators to design the certificate of completion that learners receive after completing a CME evaluation.
keyMethods: Page_Load - sets page mode, checks permissions, and initializes the form
InitializePage - handles mode branching and calls fill methods for edit or department default
StorePageParamsToState - persists CertificateID from query string
PrepareFormForEditMode - fetches certificate info by ID for editing
FillInfoFromDB - maps CMECertificateInfo to all form controls including image existence checks
FillInfoFromForm - collects form values into a CMECertificateInfo object
StoreSignature - handles logo file upload and saves to server path
BuildPath - constructs the server and DB path for certificate images
GetLogoAbsoluteImagePath - returns the logo image directory path
IsPictureFile - validates uploaded file is an image type
btnSave_Click - validates and saves or updates the certificate record
CheckForPermissions - enforces Certificates module privileges
files.migrationNote: Certificate configuration is a key feature; logo upload and template customization need migration.

files.summary: Popup form for creating or editing a conference guest presenter (non-system user), collecting title, first name, last name, and suffix, and returning the result to the parent page via JavaScript callback.
files.businessPurpose: Allows scheduling coordinators to add external guest presenters to conference schedules without creating full system user accounts.
keyMethods: Page_Load - sets page mode, checks permissions, stores params, and loads edit data if editing
StorePageParamsToState - shows/hides submit vs update buttons based on mode
CheckForPermissions - enforces ConferenceSchedules DutyHour module privileges
FillInfoFromForm - builds GuestInfo from form fields
PrepareFormForEditMode - fetches GuestInfo by ID for editing
FillInfoFromDB - populates form controls from GuestInfo
btnSubmit_Click - saves new guest and calls JavaScript Callback to parent
btnUpdate_Click - updates existing guest and calls JavaScript CallbackUpdate to parent
files.migrationNote: Guest presenter management is shared between CME and DutyHours modules.

files.summary: Popup form for creating or editing a guest lecturer (external speaker) for CME assignments, appending a '_G' suffix to the GuestID to distinguish from regular system users.
files.businessPurpose: Enables CME administrators to add external guest lecturers to CME course/event speaker lists without creating full accounts.
keyMethods: Page_Load - sets page mode, stores params, and loads edit data if in edit mode
StorePageParamsToState - toggles submit vs update button visibility by mode
CheckForPermissions - enforces ConferenceSchedules DutyHour module privileges
FillInfoFromForm - builds GuestInfo including title text from dropdown
PrepareFormForEditMode - loads guest lecturer data by ID for editing
FillInfoFromDB - populates form controls from GuestInfo
btnSubmit_Click - saves new guest lecturer and returns ID with '_G' suffix to parent via JS callback
btnUpdate_Click - updates guest lecturer and returns to parent page
btnCancel_Click - closes the popup window
files.migrationNote: Guest lecturer management for CME courses; needs to track the '_G' suffix convention in migration.

files.summary: Confirmation page for a user to decline an assigned CME evaluation, which records the declination, sends a notification email, and validates that the CME event has started.
files.businessPurpose: Allows learners to formally decline a CME evaluation assignment with optional comments, triggering an email notification to the administrator.
keyMethods: Page_Load - checks permissions, validates evaluation ID, checks if already declined, and validates event start date
CheckForPermissions - enforces CompleteCMEEvaluations module privileges
ValidateScheduleDate - blocks access if the CME event has not yet started and shows a message
btnDecline_Click - declines the evaluation, triggers email notification, and redirects
btnCancel_Click - redirects back to CMEEvaluate list
files.migrationNote: Declination workflow with email notification is a business-critical process.

files.summary: Read-only popup displaying deletion metadata for a deleted CME event, showing the event name, credits, deleted-by user, deleted date, and target audience.
files.businessPurpose: Lets administrators view who deleted a CME event and when, for audit purposes.
keyMethods: Page_Load - triggers ViewCMEEventDeleteInfo on first load
ViewCMEEventDeleteInfo - parses EventID query param and calls fill method
FillInfoByDBViewMode - maps EventInfo fields to delete audit labels
files.migrationNote: Audit information popup; simple read-only view to replicate as an API detail.

files.summary: Read-only popup showing deletion metadata for a soft-deleted CME evaluation template, including name, deleted-by, deleted date, published-by, and published date.
files.businessPurpose: Provides administrators an audit trail view for deleted CME evaluation templates.
keyMethods: Page_Load - triggers CMETemplateDeleteinfo on first load
CMETemplateDeleteinfo - fetches deleted template info by TemplateID and populates labels or hides fields if no data
files.migrationNote: Audit popup for soft-deleted templates; straightforward to replicate as an API endpoint.

files.summary: Read-only popup showing deletion metadata for a deleted CME evaluation assignment schedule, including event name, topic, location, credits, template name, created-by, and deleted-by information.
files.businessPurpose: Provides administrators an audit view of deleted CME evaluation schedules for compliance tracking.
keyMethods: Page_Load - triggers DeletedCMEEvaluationInfo on first load
DeletedCMEEvaluationInfo - fetches CME event schedule data by ScheduleID and populates labels
files.migrationNote: Audit detail popup; can be a simple API detail endpoint in the modern stack.

files.summary: Step 1 of the 4-step CME evaluation design wizard, capturing template name, comment settings (mandatory/confidential), voluntary flag, conflict-of-interest, barrier-to-entry, and competency improvement flags, storing the template in session state.
files.businessPurpose: Guides CME administrators through the first step of creating or editing a CME evaluation template by setting high-level properties.
keyMethods: Page_Load - checks permissions and initializes the page
InitializePage - sets current mode, stores params, and calls inner initialization
StorePageParamsToState - persists TemplateId and Cmd from query string
InitilizePage - handles cancel redirect storage and calls PrepareFormForEditMode
PrepareFormForEditMode - loads existing template or session data into the form
FillInfoFromDB - maps TemplateInfo fields to radio buttons and text box, updates session
btnNext_Click - validates and saves template properties to session, navigates to Step 2
CheckForPermissions - enforces CmeTemplates create privilege
btnCancel_Click - redirects to the cancel URL or evaluations list
files.migrationNote: Step 1 of the evaluation wizard; session-based multi-step form pattern must be migrated to a stateless API with client-side state.

files.summary: Step 2 of the CME evaluation wizard presenting event-level questions (CME1 audience) grouped by category with checkboxes and answer-scale selection popups, accumulating selected questions into session state.
files.businessPurpose: Allows administrators to select event-level evaluation questions and assign answer types during CME template design.
keyMethods: Page_Load - initializes page and calls DrawQuestions for CME1 audience
InitializePage - sets mode from session and triggers question rendering
SetCurrentPageMode - determines mode from session template TemplateID
DrawQuestions - dynamically renders question checkboxes grouped by core and supplementary categories
btnBack_Click - saves current selections to session and navigates back to Step 1
btnNext_Click - validates at least one question selected, saves to session, navigates to Step 3
btnCancel_Click - redirects to cancel URL or evaluations list
files.migrationNote: Step 2 of wizard with dynamic HTML generation and session accumulation; complex front-end state management to migrate.

files.summary: Step 3 of the CME evaluation wizard presenting speaker-level questions (CME2 audience) with checkbox selection and answer scale popups, accumulating speaker question selections into session state.
files.businessPurpose: Guides administrators through selecting speaker-evaluation questions for the CME template being designed.
keyMethods: Page_Load - initializes page and renders speaker questions for CME2 audience
InitializePage - sets page mode from session and calls DrawQuestions
SetCurrentPageMode - determines Add vs Edit from session template ID
DrawQuestions - dynamically generates speaker question checkboxes grouped by category
btnBack_Click - saves selections to session and navigates back to Step 2
btnNext_Click - saves speaker question selections to session and advances to Step 4
btnCancel_Click - redirects to cancel URL or evaluations list
files.migrationNote: Step 3 mirrors Step 2 for speaker questions; session-based wizard pattern needs modern multi-step form migration.

files.summary: Step 4 (final step) of the CME evaluation wizard displaying a drag-and-drop sortable question preview with conflict-of-interest, barrier-to-entry, and competency improvement panels, and saving the complete template to the database.
files.businessPurpose: Lets administrators review and reorder the final question groupings before saving or updating the CME evaluation template.
keyMethods: Page_Load - checks permissions and initializes the step
InitializePage - loads template from session or URL param and renders full question layout
AddDragDropScript - injects jQuery sortable drag-and-drop script for group reordering
SetCurrentPageMode - determines mode from URL ID or session TemplateID
ShowCustomComments - makes custom comments section visible
SetEvaluationNamelabel - sets the evaluation label text
FillGroupAndQuestions - renders conflict-of-interest, barrier, competency, and question group panels
btnFinish_Click - serializes order, validates, and saves or updates the full template
dlstGroups_ItemDataBound - dynamically renders question items within each group panel
dlstConflicts_ItemDataBound - renders conflict-of-interest question items
dlstBarriertoEntry_ItemDataBound - renders barrier-to-entry question items
dlstCompetencyImprovement_ItemDataBound - renders competency improvement question items
files.migrationNote: The most complex wizard step; drag-and-drop ordering and multi-panel question grouping require significant front-end redesign.

files.summary: The primary learner-facing evaluation submission page, rendering the full CME evaluation form with event/speaker topics, multi-topic navigation, barrier answers, MOC (Maintenance of Certification) credit selection, and partial save support.
files.businessPurpose: Enables healthcare professionals to complete and submit their assigned CME evaluations, claim MOC credits, and save partial progress.
keyMethods: Page_Load - checks expiry, binds validation scripts, calls InitializePage
InitializePage - loads evaluation info, template, schedule, renders questions, and binds MOC/credit data
CheckPermissions - enforces CompleteCMEEvaluations privileges
BindYears - populates birth year dropdown from 1900 to current year
BindMOCPoints - binds event credit values for MOC point selection
FillGroupAndQuestions - renders question groups with answers for the evaluation form
BindPageLoadData - loads initial page data and answer state
BindCMETopics - binds single or multi-topic section repeater
GetPartialCompletedTask - restores partial completion state
btnSaveAndContinue_Click - saves current answers and advances to next topic
btnSavePartial_Click - saves answers as partial completion
btnSubmit_Click - finalizes and submits the complete evaluation
files.migrationNote: The central CME evaluation form is the highest-impact page for learners; multi-topic and MOC credit workflows are complex migration targets.

files.summary: Add/Edit form for conference participant groups used in CME scheduling, allowing administrators to name a group and select its member users via a user selection user control.
files.businessPurpose: Allows CME coordinators to define named groups of participants for bulk conference attendance tracking and assignment.
keyMethods: Page_Load - sets mode, checks permissions, and initializes the form
StorePageParamsToState - persists DepartmentGroupID from query string in edit mode
CheckForPermissions - enforces ConferenceGroupParticipants view privilege and sets button visibility
GetNavigateURL - returns the redirect URL after save/update
PrepareFormForEditMode - loads group info and user list for editing
FillUserInfo - prepopulates the user selection control with existing members
FillInfoFromForm - builds GroupParticipantsInfo from form fields
btnOK_Click - saves new participant group
btnUpdate_Click - updates existing participant group
files.migrationNote: Group participant management is shared with DutyHours module; shared data model needs care during migration.

files.summary: Popup page for selecting, adding, and removing learning objectives for a CME event, with answer scale and answer type selection matching the AnswerTypeSelection page pattern.
files.businessPurpose: Allows CME administrators to define learning objectives for a CME event and assign answer types to each objective.
keyMethods: Page_Load - initializes page, fills answer scales, and binds existing learning objectives
InitializePage - sets page mode, binds controls, restores objective list from state
StorePageStateToParam - saves EventID and LearningObjectiveID params and decodes existing LO list
SetPageMode - determines Add vs Edit mode based on EventID query param
GetAnswerTypes - filters DataTable into sliding/non-sliding answer types
refreshAnswerTypeList - binds answer type lists by selected scale
drawFreeFormItems - renders free-form answer type options
GetCurrentLearningObjectiveList - retrieves LO list from page state
BindLearningObjectives - binds the grid with active (non-deleted) objectives
GetLearningObjectiveListFromString - decodes serialized LO list from hidden field
getLOList - serializes LO list back to hidden field format
btnAddLO_Click - adds a new learning objective to the session list
btnRemoveSelections_Click - marks selected objectives as deleted
btnClearAll_Click - marks all objectives as deleted
btnFinished_Click - serializes and returns the final LO list to the parent page
files.migrationNote: Learning objective selection with answer type assignment is a CME-specific workflow requiring careful migration.

files.summary: Page for adding required and optional users to an existing CME evaluation assignment, with expiry date setting, email notification, and differential tracking of new vs existing assignees.
files.businessPurpose: Allows CME administrators to expand the user list for an existing CME evaluation assignment, adding required or optional attendees after initial creation.
keyMethods: Page_Load - checks permissions, loads existing assignments and expiry date, sets up user selection controls
CheckForPermissions - enforces CmeTemplates edit privilege
FillAssignmentsFromForm - computes new required and optional users vs existing ones and identifies candidates for deletion
FillInfoFromHiddenFields - builds ScheduleTemplateInfo from form hidden fields and FillAssignmentsFromForm
btnAddNew_Click - adds new assignments, sends email notifications, and redirects
files.migrationNote: Adding users to existing assignments is a core CME administration workflow.

files.summary: Displays grids showing all users assigned to a specific CME evaluation schedule, including assignment details, quiz assignments, and per-user completion status, with delete-all and individual user management actions.
files.businessPurpose: Gives CME administrators a per-assignment roster view to manage individual user evaluation assignments.
keyMethods: Page_Load - initializes page and calls refreshGrid
InitializePage - checks permissions, checks PARS mode, configures delete button, and loads grid
StorePageStateToParm - stores TemplateID, CreatedBy, and CreatedDate from query params or ScheduleID lookup
CheckForPermissions - enforces CmeTemplates edit privilege and delete visibility
SetActionText - returns Edit or View action label based on Update privilege
refreshGrid - loads assignment and user grids from EvaluationManager data
BindAssignment - alternate bind by evaluation ID
btnDeleteAll_Click - removes all user assignments for this schedule
files.migrationNote: Assignment user roster management is a core administrator workflow.

files.summary: Alternative main-page view for CME evaluation assignment users, using MailDistributionManager to load assignment lists for both regular-user and non-user CME events in a dual-grid layout.
files.businessPurpose: Provides a consolidated view of CME evaluation assignment rosters including non-system-user registrants for PARS/MyCME+ programs.
keyMethods: Page_Load - initializes and calls refreshGrid
InitializePage - calls refreshGrid on first load
StorePageStateToParm - stores template/schedule identifiers from query params
CheckForPermissions - enforces CmeTemplates edit privilege and delete visibility
SetActionText - returns Edit or View label based on Update privilege
refreshGrid - loads both user and non-user CME event grids via MailDistributionManager
BindAssignment - alternate bind by evaluation ID
btnDeleteAll_Click - removes all user assignments
files.migrationNote: Main page variant for CME assignment roster with non-user event support; appears to be partially developed with hardcoded test data.

files.summary: Main CME assignment management list page with multi-criteria filtering (user, event, admin, audience, academic year, email list, CME event type) and sortable paginated grid showing all evaluation assignments.
files.businessPurpose: Allows CME administrators to search, view, and manage all CME evaluation assignments across users and events.
keyMethods: Page_Load - checks permissions, initializes filters, and loads the assignments grid
FillFilters - binds all filter dropdowns (audience, users, administrators, events, academic year, email list)
BindEmailList - loads email database list for email-based filtering
BindUsers - loads user list filtered by selected audience type
BindAdministrators - loads admin user dropdown
BindAudience - loads audience type dropdown
BindEvents - loads CME event filter dropdown
BindAcademicYear - populates academic year filter
refreshGrid - builds EvaluationSearchCriteria and fetches filtered assignments list
findColumnIndex - helper to find grid column by accessible header text
SetActionText - returns Edit or View label based on privilege
GenerateURL - builds URL to ManageCMEAssignmentUsers for a specific assignment
grdEvaluations_RowCommand - handles grid row delete and restore actions
files.migrationNote: Central assignment management page with complex multi-criteria search; high-priority migration target.

files.summary: List management page for CME online courses with a sortable paginated grid, add/delete actions, and show-all paging capability.
files.businessPurpose: Gives CME administrators an overview of all online CME courses with options to add new ones or delete existing ones.
keyMethods: Page_Load - checks permissions and initializes the page with the course grid
CheckForPermissions - enforces CMETracking Courses module view privilege
btnAddCourse_Click - redirects to CMECourse.aspx add form
InitializePage - binds grid and sets up pager on first load
GetDeleteConfirmScript - returns JavaScript confirm dialog script for course deletion
GenerateURL - builds edit URL for a course row
lbtnShowAll_Click - disables paging and shows all courses
RefreshGrid - fetches and binds course list from CourseManager with sort applied
lbtnPrevious_Click - navigates to previous page
lbtnNext_Click - navigates to next page
lstPageList_SelectedIndexChanged - jumps to selected page
lbtnReset_Click - resets to default paged view
grdCourses_RowCommand - handles delete row command
grdCourses_RowCreated - adds sort indicator image to header

files.summary: List page for deleted CME evaluation assignments with filtering by user, admin, and event, and a Restore action to reinstate deleted assignments.
files.businessPurpose: Allows CME administrators to view and restore soft-deleted CME evaluation assignments for audit and recovery purposes.
keyMethods: Page_Load - checks permissions, fills filters, and loads deleted assignments grid
CheckForPermissions - enforces CmeTemplates view privilege
FillFilters - binds audience, user, admin, and event filter dropdowns
BindUsers - loads users filtered by selected audience type
BindAdministrators - loads admin user dropdown
BindAudience - loads audience type dropdown
BindEvents - loads CME event filter dropdown
SetActionText - returns Restore label based on Update privilege
refreshGrid - fetches deleted assignments by criteria and binds grid
findColumnIndex - finds grid column index by accessible header text
GenerateURL - builds URL for restore action linking to ManageCMEAssignmentUsers
grdEvaluations_RowCommand - handles restore command for individual rows

files.summary: List management page for CME conference participant groups with sortable paged grid, search by group name, add/edit/delete/view actions, and delete confirmation.
files.businessPurpose: Lets CME coordinators manage named groups of participants for conference attendance assignment.
keyMethods: Page_Load - checks permissions and initializes the group participant grid
CheckForPermissions - enforces ConferenceGroupParticipants DutyHour module view privilege and hides add buttons if no create right
refreshGrid - binds group list, optionally filtered by search criteria
GetEditActionLink - builds encrypted URL to AddGroupParticipants edit form
GetViewActionLink - builds URL to print group participants view
SetActionText - returns Edit, Delete, or View label based on role privilege
GetConferenceDeleteConfirmScript - returns JavaScript confirm dialog for group deletion
grdViewGroupParticipants_RowCommand - handles delete row command
DeleteGroup - calls GroupParticipantsManager.Delete and shows success/error message
btnAddGroupParticipants_Click - redirects to AddGroupParticipants add form
btnSearch_Click - sets search criteria flag and refreshes grid

files.summary: Per-assignment learner activity view showing assignment details, per-user evaluation completion status, and quiz assignment status in multiple grids, with bulk-delete capability.
files.businessPurpose: Gives CME administrators a detailed activity view for a specific assignment, showing each learner's completion, partial, or pending status.
keyMethods: Page_Load - initializes page and calls refreshGrid
InitializePage - checks permissions and calls refreshGrid on first load
StorePageStateToParm - stores TemplateID, CreatedBy, and CreatedDate from query params or ScheduleID lookup
CheckForPermissions - enforces CmeTemplates edit privilege and delete button visibility
SetActionText - returns Edit or View label based on Update privilege
refreshGrid - loads assignment summary and per-user evaluation status grids from EvaluationManager
BindAssignment - alternate bind by evaluation ID
GetDeleteConfirmScript - returns JavaScript confirm for individual row delete
btnDeleteAll_Click - deletes all assignments in this schedule
files.migrationNote: Learner activity tracking is a key reporting/management view for CME compliance.

files.summary: List management page for CME credit certificates, with a sortable grid, add/edit/delete actions, and CSS-based link state management for published/unpublished certificates.
files.businessPurpose: Allows CME administrators to view, add, edit, and delete CME certificate templates for their department.
keyMethods: Page_Load - checks permissions and loads certificate grid
CheckForPermissions - enforces Certificates module view privilege and hides add button if no create right
refreshGrid - fetches and binds certificate list from CerificateManager with sort applied
GetDeleteConfirmScript - returns JavaScript confirm dialog script for deletion
GetEditCSS - returns CSS class based on published state
SetLinkCSS - returns active or inactive link CSS class with optional line-through
GenerateURL - builds edit URL for a certificate row
grdViewCertificateList_Sorting - handles column sort click
grdViewCertificateList_RowDeleting - executes certificate delete after confirmation
grdViewCertificateList_RowCommand - captures certificate ID for delete confirmation
grdViewCertificateList_RowDataBound - adds row ID attribute for client-side handling
grdViewCertificateList_RowCreated - adds sort indicator image to header
btnAddCertificate_Click - redirects to Certificate.aspx add form
files.migrationNote: Standard CRUD list for CME certificates; straightforward to migrate.

files.summary: Main CME evaluation template management list page with sortable paginated grid, name/status search filtering, publish/delete/copy/restore actions, and CKEditor handler URL exposure.

keyMethods: Page_Load - checks permissions and initializes grid with pager
CheckForPermissions - enforces EvaluationsTemplate view privilege
SetActionText - returns Edit or View based on Update privilege
refreshGrid - fetches template list (active or deleted) with optional name/status search criteria
GetDeleteConfirmScript - returns JavaScript confirm for template deletion
GetServerExecutionURL - returns the TemplateActions HTTP handler URL for CKEditor
Getparams - returns user and department ID parameters for handler calls
lbtnShowAll_Click - disables paging and shows all templates
lbtnNext_Click / lbtnPrevious_Click - grid pagination navigation
lstBottomPageList_SelectedIndexChanged / lstTopPageList_SelectedIndexChanged - jump to page
lbtnReset_Click - resets to default paginated view
btnSearch_Click - applies name/status search criteria and refreshes grid
grdEvaluations_RowCommand - handles delete, publish, copy, voluntary toggle, and restore commands
files.migrationNote: Central template management hub for the CME module; all template lifecycle operations flow through this page.

files.summary: Manages the list of CME evaluation questions, supporting filtering by audience and category, sortable grid display, and delete/activate/deactivate operations. Enforces role-based access via SubModule.CmeQuestions.

BindAudience - Loads CME audience list into dropdown from QuestionManager.GetCMEAdience()
FillQuestionCategory - Loads question categories filtered by selected audience ID
refreshGrid - Fetches questions by category, sorts, paginates, and binds to GridView
grdViewQuestions_RowCommand - Handles Delete and activate/deactivate commands on grid rows
lstQuestionCategory_SelectedIndexChanged - Refreshes grid when category selection changes
GenerateURL - Builds edit URL for a question item
GetDeleteConfirmScript - Returns JS confirm dialog checking delete privilege
CheckForPermissions - Redirects or hides Add button based on role privileges

files.summary: Displays a popup with detailed schedule information for a specific CME event, including event name, timing, location, topic, presenters, and an optional downloadable document. Supports file download via FileUploadServiceManager.

keyMethods: Page_Load - Sets page mode, checks permissions, and initializes page on first load
InitializePage - Reads CME schedule ID from query string and stores in session state
GetConferenceScheduleInfo - Retrieves schedule info by ID via ScheduleTemplateManager
GetConferencePresenterInfo - Retrieves and formats presenter names for display
FillInfoFromDB - Populates all display fields including event name, timing, location, topic, and document link
btnView_Click - Triggers file download for the attached document
DownLoadFile - Downloads file bytes via FileUploadServiceManager and streams to response
files.migrationNote: Simple read-only popup page; equivalent functionality in React frontend can call a schedule detail API endpoint.

files.summary: The primary CME evaluation assignment page for creating and editing multi-schedule CME assignments, supporting required/optional user lists, support sources, document attachments, competencies, learning objectives, and all event metadata. Very large and complex page with extensive multi-step wizard logic.

BindDocumentSubjects - Loads document subject list for file attachments
BindProviderShipNames - Loads providership dropdown from EventManager
BindActivityTypes - Loads CME activity types (currently commented out)
BindEventCompetencies - Loads event competencies list
BindSpecialty - Loads specialty dropdown filtered by certificate board selection
btnAddNewSupportSource_Click - Adds or updates a commercial support source entry in session state list
BindSupportSources - Binds the active support source list to the grid
files.migrationNote: Core CME assignment workflow at 5907 lines; highest-priority page for migration planning. Should be decomposed into NestJS APIs for assignment creation, support source management, and document attachment.

files.summary: Manages selection and configuration of multiple CME schedule topics within the event assignment workflow, handling topic lists, learning objectives, lecturers, credits, and date/time ranges. Supports auto-logout and postback state restoration.

getLOList - Serializes learning objective list to pipe-delimited string for client-side use
GetLearningObjectiveListFromString - Deserializes pipe-delimited LO string back to typed list

BindEventCredits - Loads credit values from EventManager
BindStartTime / BindEndTime - Populates time dropdowns in 15-minute intervals

files.summary: Empty placeholder page displayed when a CME lookup finds no matching record. Contains no logic beyond the Page_Load stub.

keyMethods: Page_Load - Empty event handler; page content is rendered entirely by ASPX markup

files.summary: Renders a printable list of participants in a CME conference group, showing the group name, each participant's name with shared/archived status indicators, and the department logo. Supports back navigation using referrer URL.

back_Click - Redirects back to referring page URL stored in ViewState

files.summary: Filter page for the CME Certificates Report, allowing selection of CME events and participants. Supports both personal (user-only) and administrative (multi-user) report modes, with role-based access control that restricts non-admin user types from the main report.

CheckForPermissions - Enforces role and user-type restrictions; non-admin user types cannot access the main report
SetFilterPanels - Shows/hides user selection step based on IsMainRpt query parameter
InitializeEventList - Loads available CME events via EventManager; includes All Events option
InitializeUsers - Loads available participants filtered by selected event and date range
lstAvailableEvents_SelectedIndexChanged - Reloads user list when event selection changes
btnAdd_Click / btnRemove_Click / btnAddAll_Click / btnRemoveAll_Click - Move users between available and selected lists

files.summary: Renders CME certificate HTML output directly to the response stream for printing, generating one certificate page per participant per event. Each certificate includes institutional logo, headings, participant name, event details, credit information, and dual signature images.

keyMethods: Page_Load - Checks permissions, initializes page state, and calls ProcessReportOutput
InitializePage - Stores report input parameters via EvaluationsReportManager
StorePageStateParams - Deserializes ReportInfo from form post
ProcessReportOutput - Streams certificate HTML for each participant row in the result dataset, including logo, signatures, and credit details; handles no-data case
files.migrationNote: Direct HTML streaming to response; migrate as a PDF generation endpoint (e.g., Puppeteer or server-side PDF library) in Node.js.

files.summary: Filter page for the CME Financial Statement report, supporting selection of events or speakers, date ranges, archive flag, format (overall vs. by event), and saved favorite report settings. Restricted to admin-level roles only.

FillInfoFromDB - Deserializes ReportInfo JSON and restores event/speaker selections, date range, format, and custom report metadata
InitializeEventList - Delegates to CMEFinancialBussiness to load events/speakers/topics
MoveUser / MoveUsers - Moves items between available and selected list boxes with sorting
rbtnListEvents_SelectedIndexChanged - Reloads event list and reselects previously chosen items
files.migrationNote: Admin-only financial report filter; migrate as a parameterized report API with React filter UI and saved settings support.

files.summary: Renders the CME Financial Statement report output by streaming HTML directly to the response, showing income and expense line items per event with totals. Includes a loading overlay and back-to-filter navigation.

files.summary: Filter page for the Summary Event Report allowing selection of a specific CME event, evaluation template, date period, topic category, and online/offline schedule period. Supports local vs. all events toggle, archived records, and saved favorite report settings. Admin-only access.

files.summary: Renders the Summary Ledger Credits Report results by streaming HTML in Page_PreInit, before the ASP.NET lifecycle processes the page. Displays per-event credit tables with participant claimed/available credit columns, and multi-event summary totals. Supports CSV and Excel export buttons and back-to-filter navigation.

files.summary: Setup page for CME connectivity configuration, loading available connectivity category names for the department and wiring a JavaScript handler for connectivity detail retrieval on dropdown change.

files.summary: Add/Edit page for CME credit types, managing the description, two activity director signatures (uploaded images), and an accreditation statement split across two text areas. Handles signature image upload, storage, and display.

files.summary: Lists and manages CME events in a sortable, paginated GridView with soft-delete and restore functionality. Supports toggling between active and deleted event lists, with confirmation dialogs for delete and restore actions.
files.businessPurpose: Allows CME administrators to view, sort, delete, and restore CME events, maintaining a soft-delete record of previously removed events that can be restored.
keyMethods: Page_Load - Checks permissions, sets grid page sizes, and loads active events on first load
CheckForPermissions - Validates CmeEvents view privilege and hides Add button if lacking Create privilege
refreshGrid - Loads active or deleted event list from EventManager and applies sort and pagination
GenerateURL - Returns edit URL for an event ID
GetDeleteConfirmScript / GetRestoreConfirmScript - Returns JS confirm dialogs for delete and restore
lbtnShowAll_Click - Disables pagination to show all records
lbtnPrevious_Click / lbtnNext_Click - Navigate paginated event grid
btnAddEvent_Click - Redirects to Event.aspx for new event
files.migrationNote: Standard event list/manage page with soft-delete; migrate as a React data table with API-backed CRUD and restore.

files.summary: Setup page for configuring the CME merchant service provider, loading available merchant service names and wiring a JavaScript startup script to pre-load saved merchant service selection.
files.businessPurpose: Allows CME administrators to select which payment/merchant service provider is configured for CME registration fee processing.
keyMethods: Page_Load - On first load, loads merchant service names dropdown from CMEConnectivityManager and registers JS to populate previously saved selection
files.migrationNote: Simple settings page for merchant service integration; migrate as a settings API endpoint.

files.summary: Loads and displays a specific uploaded user record (by fileID and uploadID query parameters) from the CME email list upload system, showing first name, last name, email, and status.
files.businessPurpose: Allows administrators to view the details of a specific user entry from an uploaded CME participant list file.
keyMethods: Page_Load - Reads fileID and uploadID from query string, fetches user record via UploadNameOfList.GetCMEUploadUser, and populates form fields
files.migrationNote: Simple read-only detail view for an uploaded user record; migrate as a detail API endpoint.

files.summary: Handles upload of an Excel (.xls/.xlsx) participant list file into the CME email database system. Parses the Excel file using EPPlus, validates file type and size, saves file to the upload directory, and imports rows into the database via UploadNameOfList.Save.
files.businessPurpose: Allows CME administrators to upload a participant list from an Excel spreadsheet, importing names and emails into the CME email database for mass communication or assignment.
keyMethods: Page_Load - Sets page mode, checks permissions, initializes page
InitializePage - Sets page title and loads edit mode data if applicable
FillInfoFromForm - Reads form inputs including file upload, validates extension and size
FileImporting - Parses Excel file with EPPlus, imports all rows into database via UploadNameOfList.Save, and saves file to server
btnSave_Click - Validates, calls FileImporting, redirects to ManageEmailDatabase
btnUpdate_Click - Update path (partially implemented, redirect only)
getLOList / GetLearningObjectiveListFromString - Learning objective serialization utilities (included as shared helpers)
files.migrationNote: File upload and Excel parsing for participant lists; migrate as a multipart upload API endpoint with server-side Excel parsing (e.g., ExcelJS in Node.js).

files.summary: Displays details of a CME evaluation to be undone, including event name, department, start/end dates, expiry date, user name, creator, and completed date. Redirects to NoRecordFoundForAll if no matching evaluation found.
files.businessPurpose: Provides a confirmation view showing the evaluation details before an administrator undoes or reverses a completed CME evaluation submission.
keyMethods: Page_Load - Calls UndoCMEEvaluationInfo on first load
UndoCMEEvaluationInfo - Reads EvaluationID from query string, fetches evaluation undo info via EvaluationManager, populates labels or redirects if not found
files.migrationNote: Undo/reverse evaluation confirmation page; the undo action itself should be a POST API endpoint in NestJS.

files.summary: Attendance verification gate page for CME evaluations. Displays accreditation and disclosure statements from the schedule, checks if the user has already completed the evaluation or if the event hasn't started, and prompts the user to confirm attendance before proceeding to the evaluation.
files.businessPurpose: Ensures users verify their physical attendance at a CME event before they can access and complete the CME evaluation, with credentialing statement display.
keyMethods: InitializePage - Reads evaluation/template/schedule IDs, loads credentialing info from schedule, checks existing completion status, validates event start date, and renders appropriate attendance prompt or redirect
btnYes_Click - Verifies attendance via EvaluationManager.VerifyEvaluationAttendance and redirects to VerifyEvaluationAttendance page
btnNo_Click - Shows a message that attendance is required
GetRedirecctUrl - Builds redirect URL with evaluation/template/schedule IDs
files.migrationNote: Critical attendance verification workflow gate; migrate as a NestJS API endpoint for attendance confirmation with frontend React modal.

files.summary: Second step of the CME attendance verification flow, allowing users to enter an attendance ID code to confirm their presence at a conference. Enforces a 45-day restriction on late verification and routes verified users to the CME evaluation.
files.businessPurpose: Provides an attendance ID-based verification mechanism for CME events, ensuring only users who physically attended the conference can complete the associated evaluation and claim credits.
keyMethods: Page_Load - Reads evaluation/template/schedule IDs, checks existing attendance status, displays event details for verification
btnOK_Click - Redirects to CMEEvaluate.aspx without further verification
btnSubmit_Click - Validates attendance ID, checks 45-day rule, verifies attendance via EvaluationManager.VerifyCMEEvaluationAttendance, and redirects on success
GetRedirecctUrl - Builds redirect URL to EvaluateCMEEvaluation.aspx with IDs
files.migrationNote: Attendance ID verification with 45-day business rule; migrate as a NestJS API POST endpoint with validation logic.

directoryOverview: CME Tracking reports, setup, and schedule assignment pages covering the full administrative workflow for continuing medical education: event and credit type management, multi-schedule evaluation assignment, attendance verification, and a comprehensive suite of reporting pages including certificates, financial statements, detailed ledger credits, and summary event/evaluation reports.
keyWorkflows: CME credit ledger reporting (detailed and summary)
Financial statement reporting for CME events
Excel participant list upload to email database
Credit type and credentialing info setup
